item.title: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 115-502.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
ANCSA Admiralty Island Land Exchange Finalization Act of 2017

This bill requires the Department of Agriculture (USDA) to convey specified land to the Sealaska Corporation, an Alaska Native regional corporation, if the corporation relinquishes a specified 23,000 acres of subsurface estate. The land to be conveyed by USDA to the corporation consists of 8,873 acres of surface and subsurface estate and 5,145 acres of surface estate.

bill.title: ANCSA Admiralty Island Land Exchange Finalization Act of 2017

item.title: ANCSA Admiralty Island Land Exchange Finalization Act of 2017
A bill to provide for a land exchange relating to the Admiralty Island National Monument, and for other purposes.
ANCSA Admiralty Island Land Exchange Finalization Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
